interfaces.hardware.device_drivers¶

Source: src\interfaces\hardware\device_drivers.py

Module Overview¶

Base device driver framework for hardware abstraction. This module provides the foundational classes and interfaces for implementing device drivers in control systems, including device lifecycle management, error handling, and standardized communication patterns.

Complete Source Code¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#===================== src/interfaces/hardware/device_drivers.py ======================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Base device driver framework for hardware abstraction.
  7This module provides the foundational classes and interfaces for implementing
  8device drivers in control systems, including device lifecycle management,
  9error handling, and standardized communication patterns.
 10"""
 11
 12import asyncio
 13import time
 14from abc import ABC, abstractmethod
 15from dataclasses import dataclass, field
 16from typing import Dict, Any, Optional, List, Callable
 17from enum import Enum
 18import logging
 19
 20
 21
 22class DeviceState(Enum):
 23    """Device operational state enumeration."""
 24    UNKNOWN = "unknown"
 25    INITIALIZING = "initializing"
 26    READY = "ready"
 27    RUNNING = "running"
 28    ERROR = "error"
 29    MAINTENANCE = "maintenance"
 30    OFFLINE = "offline"
 31
 32
 33class DeviceError(Exception):
 34    """Base exception for device-related errors."""
 35    def __init__(self, message: str, device_id: str, error_code: Optional[str] = None):
 36        self.device_id = device_id
 37        self.error_code = error_code
 38        super().__init__(f"Device {device_id}: {message}")
 39
 40
 41@dataclass
 42class DeviceCapability:
 43    """Device capability description."""
 44    name: str
 45    description: str
 46    data_type: str
 47    unit: Optional[str] = None
 48    range_min: Optional[float] = None
 49    range_max: Optional[float] = None
 50    resolution: Optional[float] = None
 51    read_only: bool = False
 52
 53
 54@dataclass
 55class DeviceConfig:
 56    """Device configuration structure."""
 57    device_id: str
 58    device_type: str
 59    connection_params: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
 60    operational_params: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
 61    calibration_params: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)
 62    safety_limits: Dict[str, tuple] = field(default_factory=dict)
 63    update_rate: float = 10.0  # Hz
 64    timeout: float = 1.0
 65    retry_attempts: int = 3
 66    enable_logging: bool = True
 67
 68
 69@dataclass
 70class DeviceStatus:
 71    """Device status information."""
 72    device_id: str
 73    state: DeviceState = DeviceState.UNKNOWN
 74    last_update: float = field(default_factory=time.time)
 75    error_count: int = 0
 76    warning_count: int = 0
 77    uptime: float = 0.0
 78    temperature: Optional[float] = None
 79    voltage: Optional[float] = None
 80    current: Optional[float] = None
 81    metrics: Dict[str, float] = field(default_factory=dict)
 82    alerts: List[str] = field(default_factory=list)
 83
 84    def update_timestamp(self):
 85        """Update the last update timestamp."""
 86        self.last_update = time.time()
 87
 88    def add_metric(self, name: str, value: float):
 89        """Add a performance metric."""
 90        self.metrics[name] = value
 91
 92    def add_alert(self, message: str):
 93        """Add an alert message."""
 94        self.alerts.append(f"{time.time()}: {message}")
 95        if len(self.alerts) > 100:  # Keep only last 100 alerts
 96            self.alerts.pop(0)
 97
 98
 99class DeviceDriver(ABC):
100    """
101    Abstract base class for all device drivers.
102
103    This class defines the standard interface that all device drivers
104    must implement, providing consistent patterns for device lifecycle
105    management, communication, and error handling.
106    """
107
108    def __init__(self, config: DeviceConfig):
109        """Initialize device driver with configuration."""
110        self._config = config
111        self._status = DeviceStatus(device_id=config.device_id)
112        self._capabilities: List[DeviceCapability] = []
113        self._logger = logging.getLogger(f"device_{config.device_id}")
114        self._error_handlers: List[Callable] = []
115        self._status_callbacks: List[Callable] = []
116        self._update_task: Optional[asyncio.Task] = None
117        self._last_read_time = 0.0
118
119    @property
120    def device_id(self) -> str:
121        """Get device identifier."""
122        return self._config.device_id
123
124    @property
125    def device_type(self) -> str:
126        """Get device type."""
127        return self._config.device_type
128
129    @property
130    def state(self) -> DeviceState:
131        """Get current device state."""
132        return self._status.state
133
134    @property
135    def status(self) -> DeviceStatus:
136        """Get device status."""
137        return self._status
138
139    @property
140    def capabilities(self) -> List[DeviceCapability]:
141        """Get device capabilities."""
142        return self._capabilities.copy()
143
144    @property
145    def config(self) -> DeviceConfig:
146        """Get device configuration."""
147        return self._config
148
149    @abstractmethod
150    async def initialize(self) -> bool:
151        """
152        Initialize the device.
153
154        Returns
155        -------
156        bool
157            True if initialization successful, False otherwise
158        """
159        pass
160
161    @abstractmethod
162    async def shutdown(self) -> bool:
163        """
164        Shutdown the device gracefully.
165
166        Returns
167        -------
168        bool
169            True if shutdown successful, False otherwise
170        """
171        pass
172
173    @abstractmethod
174    async def read_data(self, channel: Optional[str] = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
175        """
176        Read data from the device.
177
178        Parameters
179        ----------
180        channel : str, optional
181            Specific channel to read from
182
183        Returns
184        -------
185        Dict[str, Any]
186            Dictionary of channel names to values
187        """
188        pass
189
190    @abstractmethod
191    async def write_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
192        """
193        Write data to the device.
194
195        Parameters
196        ----------
197        data : Dict[str, Any]
198            Dictionary of channel names to values
199
200        Returns
201        -------
202        bool
203            True if write successful, False otherwise
204        """
205        pass
206
207    @abstractmethod
208    async def self_test(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
209        """
210        Perform device self-test.
211
212        Returns
213        -------
214        Dict[str, Any]
215            Self-test results
216        """
217        pass
218
219    async def start(self) -> bool:
220        """Start device operation."""
221        try:
222            self._status.state = DeviceState.INITIALIZING
223            self._notify_status_change()
224
225            if not await self.initialize():
226                self._status.state = DeviceState.ERROR
227                self._notify_status_change()
228                return False
229
230            self._status.state = DeviceState.RUNNING
231            self._status.uptime = time.time()
232            self._notify_status_change()
233
234            # Start update task if update rate is specified
235            if self._config.update_rate > 0:
236                self._update_task = asyncio.create_task(self._update_loop())
237
238            self._logger.info(f"Device {self.device_id} started successfully")
239            return True
240
241        except Exception as e:
242            self._logger.error(f"Failed to start device {self.device_id}: {e}")
243            self._status.state = DeviceState.ERROR
244            self._notify_status_change()
245            await self._handle_error(e)
246            return False
247
248    async def stop(self) -> bool:
249        """Stop device operation."""
250        try:
251            # Cancel update task
252            if self._update_task:
253                self._update_task.cancel()
254                try:
255                    await self._update_task
256                except asyncio.CancelledError:
257                    pass
258
259            # Shutdown device
260            await self.shutdown()
261
262            self._status.state = DeviceState.OFFLINE
263            self._notify_status_change()
264
265            self._logger.info(f"Device {self.device_id} stopped")
266            return True
267
268        except Exception as e:
269            self._logger.error(f"Error stopping device {self.device_id}: {e}")
270            await self._handle_error(e)
271            return False
272
273    async def restart(self) -> bool:
274        """Restart device operation."""
275        self._logger.info(f"Restarting device {self.device_id}")
276        await self.stop()
277        await asyncio.sleep(1.0)  # Brief pause before restart
278        return await self.start()
279
280    async def calibrate(self, calibration_data: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None) -> bool:
281        """
282        Calibrate the device.
283
284        Parameters
285        ----------
286        calibration_data : Dict[str, Any], optional
287            Calibration parameters
288
289        Returns
290        -------
291        bool
292            True if calibration successful
293        """
294        try:
295            self._logger.info(f"Calibrating device {self.device_id}")
296            # Default implementation - override in subclasses
297            return True
298        except Exception as e:
299            self._logger.error(f"Calibration failed for device {self.device_id}: {e}")
300            await self._handle_error(e)
301            return False
302
303    async def reset(self) -> bool:
304        """
305        Reset device to default state.
306
307        Returns
308        -------
309        bool
310            True if reset successful
311        """
312        try:
313            self._logger.info(f"Resetting device {self.device_id}")
314            self._status.error_count = 0
315            self._status.warning_count = 0
316            self._status.alerts.clear()
317            return True
318        except Exception as e:
319            self._logger.error(f"Reset failed for device {self.device_id}: {e}")
320            await self._handle_error(e)
321            return False
322
323    def add_capability(self, capability: DeviceCapability) -> None:
324        """Add device capability."""
325        self._capabilities.append(capability)
326
327    def get_capability(self, name: str) -> Optional[DeviceCapability]:
328        """Get specific capability by name."""
329        for cap in self._capabilities:
330            if cap.name == name:
331                return cap
332        return None
333
334    def add_error_handler(self, handler: Callable) -> None:
335        """Add error handler callback."""
336        self._error_handlers.append(handler)
337
338    def add_status_callback(self, callback: Callable) -> None:
339        """Add status change callback."""
340        self._status_callbacks.append(callback)
341
342    async def _update_loop(self) -> None:
343        """Continuous update loop for device monitoring."""
344        try:
345            update_interval = 1.0 / self._config.update_rate
346
347            while self._status.state == DeviceState.RUNNING:
348                try:
349                    # Update device status
350                    await self._update_status()
351
352                    # Check for safety violations
353                    await self._check_safety_limits()
354
355                    await asyncio.sleep(update_interval)
356
357                except Exception as e:
358                    self._logger.warning(f"Error in update loop for device {self.device_id}: {e}")
359                    self._status.error_count += 1
360
361        except asyncio.CancelledError:
362            pass
363        except Exception as e:
364            self._logger.error(f"Update loop failed for device {self.device_id}: {e}")
365            self._status.state = DeviceState.ERROR
366            await self._handle_error(e)
367
368    async def _update_status(self) -> None:
369        """Update device status information."""
370        current_time = time.time()
371        if self._status.uptime > 0:
372            self._status.uptime = current_time - self._status.uptime
373
374        self._status.update_timestamp()
375
376        # Update metrics
377        if current_time - self._last_read_time > 1.0:  # Update every second
378            try:
379                data = await self.read_data()
380                for key, value in data.items():
381                    if isinstance(value, (int, float)):
382                        self._status.add_metric(f"last_{key}", float(value))
383                self._last_read_time = current_time
384            except Exception as e:
385                self._logger.debug(f"Error reading data in status update: {e}")
386
387    async def _check_safety_limits(self) -> None:
388        """Check safety limits and trigger alerts if violated."""
389        try:
390            data = await self.read_data()
391            for channel, value in data.items():
392                if channel in self._config.safety_limits:
393                    min_val, max_val = self._config.safety_limits[channel]
394                    if not (min_val <= value <= max_val):
395                        alert_msg = f"Safety limit violation: {channel}={value} not in [{min_val}, {max_val}]"
396                        self._status.add_alert(alert_msg)
397                        self._logger.warning(alert_msg)
398        except Exception as e:
399            self._logger.debug(f"Error checking safety limits: {e}")
400
401    async def _handle_error(self, error: Exception) -> None:
402        """Handle device errors."""
403        self._status.error_count += 1
404
405        # Call error handlers
406        for handler in self._error_handlers:
407            try:
408                if asyncio.iscoroutinefunction(handler):
409                    await handler(self, error)
410                else:
411                    handler(self, error)
412            except Exception as handler_error:
413                self._logger.error(f"Error in error handler: {handler_error}")
414
415    def _notify_status_change(self) -> None:
416        """Notify status change callbacks."""
417        for callback in self._status_callbacks:
418            try:
419                if asyncio.iscoroutinefunction(callback):
420                    asyncio.create_task(callback(self, self._status))
421                else:
422                    callback(self, self._status)
423            except Exception as e:
424                self._logger.error(f"Error in status callback: {e}")
425
426
427class BaseDevice(DeviceDriver):
428    """
429    Base implementation of DeviceDriver with common functionality.
430
431    This class provides default implementations for common device operations
432    and can be used as a starting point for simple device drivers.
433    """
434
435    def __init__(self, config: DeviceConfig):
436        """Initialize base device."""
437        super().__init__(config)
438        self._data_cache: Dict[str, Any] = {}
439        self._last_cache_update = 0.0
440        self._cache_timeout = 0.1  # 100ms cache timeout
441
442    async def initialize(self) -> bool:
443        """Initialize base device."""
444        self._logger.info(f"Initializing base device {self.device_id}")
445
446        # Perform basic initialization
447        await asyncio.sleep(0.1)  # Simulate initialization delay
448
449        # Add basic capabilities
450        self.add_capability(DeviceCapability(
451            name="status",
452            description="Device status information",
453            data_type="dict",
454            read_only=True
455        ))
456
457        return True
458
459    async def shutdown(self) -> bool:
460        """Shutdown base device."""
461        self._logger.info(f"Shutting down base device {self.device_id}")
462        self._data_cache.clear()
463        return True
464
465    async def read_data(self, channel: Optional[str] = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
466        """Read data from base device."""
467        current_time = time.time()
468
469        # Check cache validity
470        if (current_time - self._last_cache_update) < self._cache_timeout:
471            if channel:
472                return {channel: self._data_cache.get(channel)} if channel in self._data_cache else {}
473            return self._data_cache.copy()
474
475        # Update cache with fresh data
476        await self._update_data_cache()
477        self._last_cache_update = current_time
478
479        if channel:
480            return {channel: self._data_cache.get(channel)} if channel in self._data_cache else {}
481        return self._data_cache.copy()
482
483    async def write_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
484        """Write data to base device."""
485        try:
486            for channel, value in data.items():
487                self._logger.debug(f"Writing {channel}={value} to device {self.device_id}")
488                # Base implementation just logs the write
489                # Override in subclasses for actual hardware interaction
490
491            return True
492
493        except Exception as e:
494            self._logger.error(f"Error writing data to device {self.device_id}: {e}")
495            return False
496
497    async def self_test(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
498        """Perform base device self-test."""
499        test_results = {
500            'timestamp': time.time(),
501            'device_id': self.device_id,
502            'communication': True,
503            'initialization': self._status.state != DeviceState.ERROR,
504            'data_integrity': True,
505            'overall_status': 'PASS'
506        }
507
508        # Check if device is responsive
509        try:
510            await self.read_data()
511        except Exception:
512            test_results['communication'] = False
513            test_results['overall_status'] = 'FAIL'
514
515        return test_results
516
517    async def _update_data_cache(self) -> None:
518        """Update internal data cache."""
519        # Base implementation provides synthetic data
520        # Override in subclasses for actual device data
521        self._data_cache = {
522            'timestamp': time.time(),
523            'device_id': self.device_id,
524            'status': self._status.state.value,
525            'uptime': self._status.uptime,
526            'error_count': self._status.error_count
527        }
528
529
530class DeviceManager:
531    """
532    Manager for multiple device drivers.
533
534    This class provides centralized management of multiple devices,
535    including lifecycle coordination, status monitoring, and
536    coordinated operations.
537    """
538
539    def __init__(self):
540        """Initialize device manager."""
541        self._devices: Dict[str, DeviceDriver] = {}
542        self._logger = logging.getLogger("device_manager")
543
544    def add_device(self, device: DeviceDriver) -> None:
545        """Add device to manager."""
546        device_id = device.device_id
547        if device_id in self._devices:
548            raise ValueError(f"Device {device_id} already exists in manager")
549
550        self._devices[device_id] = device
551        self._logger.info(f"Added device {device_id} to manager")
552
553    def remove_device(self, device_id: str) -> Optional[DeviceDriver]:
554        """Remove device from manager."""
555        device = self._devices.pop(device_id, None)
556        if device:
557            self._logger.info(f"Removed device {device_id} from manager")
558        return device
559
560    def get_device(self, device_id: str) -> Optional[DeviceDriver]:
561        """Get device by ID."""
562        return self._devices.get(device_id)
563
564    def list_devices(self) -> List[str]:
565        """List all device IDs."""
566        return list(self._devices.keys())
567
568    def get_devices_by_type(self, device_type: str) -> List[DeviceDriver]:
569        """Get all devices of specific type."""
570        return [
571            device for device in self._devices.values()
572            if device.device_type == device_type
573        ]
574
575    async def start_all(self) -> Dict[str, bool]:
576        """Start all devices."""
577        results = {}
578        for device_id, device in self._devices.items():
579            try:
580                results[device_id] = await device.start()
581            except Exception as e:
582                self._logger.error(f"Failed to start device {device_id}: {e}")
583                results[device_id] = False
584
585        return results
586
587    async def stop_all(self) -> Dict[str, bool]:
588        """Stop all devices."""
589        results = {}
590        for device_id, device in self._devices.items():
591            try:
592                results[device_id] = await device.stop()
593            except Exception as e:
594                self._logger.error(f"Failed to stop device {device_id}: {e}")
595                results[device_id] = False
596
597        return results
598
599    async def restart_all(self) -> Dict[str, bool]:
600        """Restart all devices."""
601        results = {}
602        for device_id, device in self._devices.items():
603            try:
604                results[device_id] = await device.restart()
605            except Exception as e:
606                self._logger.error(f"Failed to restart device {device_id}: {e}")
607                results[device_id] = False
608
609        return results
610
611    def get_status_summary(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
612        """Get status summary for all devices."""
613        summary = {
614            'total_devices': len(self._devices),
615            'states': {},
616            'error_count': 0,
617            'warning_count': 0,
618            'devices': {}
619        }
620
621        for device_id, device in self._devices.items():
622            state = device.state.value
623            summary['states'][state] = summary['states'].get(state, 0) + 1
624            summary['error_count'] += device.status.error_count
625            summary['warning_count'] += device.status.warning_count
626            summary['devices'][device_id] = {
627                'state': state,
628                'type': device.device_type,
629                'last_update': device.status.last_update,
630                'error_count': device.status.error_count
631            }
632
633        return summary
634
635    async def health_check_all(self) -> Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]:
636        """Perform health check on all devices."""
637        results = {}
638        for device_id, device in self._devices.items():
639            try:
640                results[device_id] = await device.self_test()
641            except Exception as e:
642                self._logger.error(f"Health check failed for device {device_id}: {e}")
643                results[device_id] = {
644                    'overall_status': 'FAIL',
645                    'error': str(e)
646                }
647
648        return results

1class DeviceState(Enum):
2    """Device operational state enumeration."""
3    UNKNOWN = "unknown"
4    INITIALIZING = "initializing"
5    READY = "ready"
6    RUNNING = "running"
7    ERROR = "error"
8    MAINTENANCE = "maintenance"
9    OFFLINE = "offline"

 5    device_type: str

 7    operational_params: Dict[str, Any] = field(default_factory=dict)

11    timeout: float = 1.0

DeviceStatus¶

Device status information.

Source Code¶

 1@dataclass
 2class DeviceStatus:
 3    """Device status information."""
 4    device_id: str
 5    state: DeviceState = DeviceState.UNKNOWN
 6    last_update: float = field(default_factory=time.time)
 7    error_count: int = 0
 8    warning_count: int = 0
 9    uptime: float = 0.0
10    temperature: Optional[float] = None
11    voltage: Optional[float] = None
12    current: Optional[float] = None
13    metrics: Dict[str, float] = field(default_factory=dict)
14    alerts: List[str] = field(default_factory=list)
15
16    def update_timestamp(self):
17        """Update the last update timestamp."""
18        self.last_update = time.time()
19
20    def add_metric(self, name: str, value: float):
21        """Add a performance metric."""
22        self.metrics[name] = value
23
24    def add_alert(self, message: str):
25        """Add an alert message."""
26        self.alerts.append(f"{time.time()}: {message}")
27        if len(self.alerts) > 100:  # Keep only last 100 alerts
28            self.alerts.pop(0)

DeviceDriver¶

Inherits from: ABC

Abstract base class for all device drivers.

This class defines the standard interface that all device drivers must implement, providing consistent patterns for device lifecycle management, communication, and error handling.

Source Code¶

  1class DeviceDriver(ABC):
  2    """
  3    Abstract base class for all device drivers.
  4
  5    This class defines the standard interface that all device drivers
  6    must implement, providing consistent patterns for device lifecycle
  7    management, communication, and error handling.
  8    """
  9
 10    def __init__(self, config: DeviceConfig):
 11        """Initialize device driver with configuration."""
 12        self._config = config
 13        self._status = DeviceStatus(device_id=config.device_id)
 14        self._capabilities: List[DeviceCapability] = []
 15        self._logger = logging.getLogger(f"device_{config.device_id}")
 16        self._error_handlers: List[Callable] = []
 17        self._status_callbacks: List[Callable] = []
 18        self._update_task: Optional[asyncio.Task] = None
 19        self._last_read_time = 0.0
 20
 21    @property
 22    def device_id(self) -> str:
 23        """Get device identifier."""
 24        return self._config.device_id
 25
 26    @property
 27    def device_type(self) -> str:
 28        """Get device type."""
 29        return self._config.device_type
 30
 31    @property
 32    def state(self) -> DeviceState:
 33        """Get current device state."""
 34        return self._status.state
 35
 36    @property
 37    def status(self) -> DeviceStatus:
 38        """Get device status."""
 39        return self._status
 40
 41    @property
 42    def capabilities(self) -> List[DeviceCapability]:
 43        """Get device capabilities."""
 44        return self._capabilities.copy()
 45
 46    @property
 47    def config(self) -> DeviceConfig:
 48        """Get device configuration."""
 49        return self._config
 50
 51    @abstractmethod
 52    async def initialize(self) -> bool:
 53        """
 54        Initialize the device.
 55
 56        Returns
 57        -------
 58        bool
 59            True if initialization successful, False otherwise
 60        """
 61        pass
 62
 63    @abstractmethod
 64    async def shutdown(self) -> bool:
 65        """
 66        Shutdown the device gracefully.
 67
 68        Returns
 69        -------
 70        bool
 71            True if shutdown successful, False otherwise
 72        """
 73        pass
 74
 75    @abstractmethod
 76    async def read_data(self, channel: Optional[str] = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 77        """
 78        Read data from the device.
 79
 80        Parameters
 81        ----------
 82        channel : str, optional
 83            Specific channel to read from
 84
 85        Returns
 86        -------
 87        Dict[str, Any]
 88            Dictionary of channel names to values
 89        """
 90        pass
 91
 92    @abstractmethod
 93    async def write_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
 94        """
 95        Write data to the device.
 96
 97        Parameters
 98        ----------
 99        data : Dict[str, Any]
100            Dictionary of channel names to values
101
102        Returns
103        -------
104        bool
105            True if write successful, False otherwise
106        """
107        pass
108
109    @abstractmethod
110    async def self_test(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
111        """
112        Perform device self-test.
113
114        Returns
115        -------
116        Dict[str, Any]
117            Self-test results
118        """
119        pass
120
121    async def start(self) -> bool:
122        """Start device operation."""
123        try:
124            self._status.state = DeviceState.INITIALIZING
125            self._notify_status_change()
126
127            if not await self.initialize():
128                self._status.state = DeviceState.ERROR
129                self._notify_status_change()
130                return False
131
132            self._status.state = DeviceState.RUNNING
133            self._status.uptime = time.time()
134            self._notify_status_change()
135
136            # Start update task if update rate is specified
137            if self._config.update_rate > 0:
138                self._update_task = asyncio.create_task(self._update_loop())
139
140            self._logger.info(f"Device {self.device_id} started successfully")
141            return True
142
143        except Exception as e:
144            self._logger.error(f"Failed to start device {self.device_id}: {e}")
145            self._status.state = DeviceState.ERROR
146            self._notify_status_change()
147            await self._handle_error(e)
148            return False
149
150    async def stop(self) -> bool:
151        """Stop device operation."""
152        try:
153            # Cancel update task
154            if self._update_task:
155                self._update_task.cancel()
156                try:
157                    await self._update_task
158                except asyncio.CancelledError:
159                    pass
160
161            # Shutdown device
162            await self.shutdown()
163
164            self._status.state = DeviceState.OFFLINE
165            self._notify_status_change()
166
167            self._logger.info(f"Device {self.device_id} stopped")
168            return True
169
170        except Exception as e:
171            self._logger.error(f"Error stopping device {self.device_id}: {e}")
172            await self._handle_error(e)
173            return False
174
175    async def restart(self) -> bool:
176        """Restart device operation."""
177        self._logger.info(f"Restarting device {self.device_id}")
178        await self.stop()
179        await asyncio.sleep(1.0)  # Brief pause before restart
180        return await self.start()
181
182    async def calibrate(self, calibration_data: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None) -> bool:
183        """
184        Calibrate the device.
185
186        Parameters
187        ----------
188        calibration_data : Dict[str, Any], optional
189            Calibration parameters
190
191        Returns
192        -------
193        bool
194            True if calibration successful
195        """
196        try:
197            self._logger.info(f"Calibrating device {self.device_id}")
198            # Default implementation - override in subclasses
199            return True
200        except Exception as e:
201            self._logger.error(f"Calibration failed for device {self.device_id}: {e}")
202            await self._handle_error(e)
203            return False
204
205    async def reset(self) -> bool:
206        """
207        Reset device to default state.
208
209        Returns
210        -------
211        bool
212            True if reset successful
213        """
214        try:
215            self._logger.info(f"Resetting device {self.device_id}")
216            self._status.error_count = 0
217            self._status.warning_count = 0
218            self._status.alerts.clear()
219            return True
220        except Exception as e:
221            self._logger.error(f"Reset failed for device {self.device_id}: {e}")
222            await self._handle_error(e)
223            return False
224
225    def add_capability(self, capability: DeviceCapability) -> None:
226        """Add device capability."""
227        self._capabilities.append(capability)
228
229    def get_capability(self, name: str) -> Optional[DeviceCapability]:
230        """Get specific capability by name."""
231        for cap in self._capabilities:
232            if cap.name == name:
233                return cap
234        return None
235
236    def add_error_handler(self, handler: Callable) -> None:
237        """Add error handler callback."""
238        self._error_handlers.append(handler)
239
240    def add_status_callback(self, callback: Callable) -> None:
241        """Add status change callback."""
242        self._status_callbacks.append(callback)
243
244    async def _update_loop(self) -> None:
245        """Continuous update loop for device monitoring."""
246        try:
247            update_interval = 1.0 / self._config.update_rate
248
249            while self._status.state == DeviceState.RUNNING:
250                try:
251                    # Update device status
252                    await self._update_status()
253
254                    # Check for safety violations
255                    await self._check_safety_limits()
256
257                    await asyncio.sleep(update_interval)
258
259                except Exception as e:
260                    self._logger.warning(f"Error in update loop for device {self.device_id}: {e}")
261                    self._status.error_count += 1
262
263        except asyncio.CancelledError:
264            pass
265        except Exception as e:
266            self._logger.error(f"Update loop failed for device {self.device_id}: {e}")
267            self._status.state = DeviceState.ERROR
268            await self._handle_error(e)
269
270    async def _update_status(self) -> None:
271        """Update device status information."""
272        current_time = time.time()
273        if self._status.uptime > 0:
274            self._status.uptime = current_time - self._status.uptime
275
276        self._status.update_timestamp()
277
278        # Update metrics
279        if current_time - self._last_read_time > 1.0:  # Update every second
280            try:
281                data = await self.read_data()
282                for key, value in data.items():
283                    if isinstance(value, (int, float)):
284                        self._status.add_metric(f"last_{key}", float(value))
285                self._last_read_time = current_time
286            except Exception as e:
287                self._logger.debug(f"Error reading data in status update: {e}")
288
289    async def _check_safety_limits(self) -> None:
290        """Check safety limits and trigger alerts if violated."""
291        try:
292            data = await self.read_data()
293            for channel, value in data.items():
294                if channel in self._config.safety_limits:
295                    min_val, max_val = self._config.safety_limits[channel]
296                    if not (min_val <= value <= max_val):
297                        alert_msg = f"Safety limit violation: {channel}={value} not in [{min_val}, {max_val}]"
298                        self._status.add_alert(alert_msg)
299                        self._logger.warning(alert_msg)
300        except Exception as e:
301            self._logger.debug(f"Error checking safety limits: {e}")
302
303    async def _handle_error(self, error: Exception) -> None:
304        """Handle device errors."""
305        self._status.error_count += 1
306
307        # Call error handlers
308        for handler in self._error_handlers:
309            try:
310                if asyncio.iscoroutinefunction(handler):
311                    await handler(self, error)
312                else:
313                    handler(self, error)
314            except Exception as handler_error:
315                self._logger.error(f"Error in error handler: {handler_error}")
316
317    def _notify_status_change(self) -> None:
318        """Notify status change callbacks."""
319        for callback in self._status_callbacks:
320            try:
321                if asyncio.iscoroutinefunction(callback):
322                    asyncio.create_task(callback(self, self._status))
323                else:
324                    callback(self, self._status)
325            except Exception as e:
326                self._logger.error(f"Error in status callback: {e}")

BaseDevice¶

Inherits from: DeviceDriver

Base implementation of DeviceDriver with common functionality.

This class provides default implementations for common device operations and can be used as a starting point for simple device drivers.

Source Code¶

  1class BaseDevice(DeviceDriver):
  2    """
  3    Base implementation of DeviceDriver with common functionality.
  4
  5    This class provides default implementations for common device operations
  6    and can be used as a starting point for simple device drivers.
  7    """
  8
  9    def __init__(self, config: DeviceConfig):
 10        """Initialize base device."""
 11        super().__init__(config)
 12        self._data_cache: Dict[str, Any] = {}
 13        self._last_cache_update = 0.0
 14        self._cache_timeout = 0.1  # 100ms cache timeout
 15
 16    async def initialize(self) -> bool:
 17        """Initialize base device."""
 18        self._logger.info(f"Initializing base device {self.device_id}")
 19
 20        # Perform basic initialization
 21        await asyncio.sleep(0.1)  # Simulate initialization delay
 22
 23        # Add basic capabilities
 24        self.add_capability(DeviceCapability(
 25            name="status",
 26            description="Device status information",
 27            data_type="dict",
 28            read_only=True
 29        ))
 30
 31        return True
 32
 33    async def shutdown(self) -> bool:
 34        """Shutdown base device."""
 35        self._logger.info(f"Shutting down base device {self.device_id}")
 36        self._data_cache.clear()
 37        return True
 38
 39    async def read_data(self, channel: Optional[str] = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 40        """Read data from base device."""
 41        current_time = time.time()
 42
 43        # Check cache validity
 44        if (current_time - self._last_cache_update) < self._cache_timeout:
 45            if channel:
 46                return {channel: self._data_cache.get(channel)} if channel in self._data_cache else {}
 47            return self._data_cache.copy()
 48
 49        # Update cache with fresh data
 50        await self._update_data_cache()
 51        self._last_cache_update = current_time
 52
 53        if channel:
 54            return {channel: self._data_cache.get(channel)} if channel in self._data_cache else {}
 55        return self._data_cache.copy()
 56
 57    async def write_data(self, data: Dict[str, Any]) -> bool:
 58        """Write data to base device."""
 59        try:
 60            for channel, value in data.items():
 61                self._logger.debug(f"Writing {channel}={value} to device {self.device_id}")
 62                # Base implementation just logs the write
 63                # Override in subclasses for actual hardware interaction
 64
 65            return True
 66
 67        except Exception as e:
 68            self._logger.error(f"Error writing data to device {self.device_id}: {e}")
 69            return False
 70
 71    async def self_test(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 72        """Perform base device self-test."""
 73        test_results = {
 74            'timestamp': time.time(),
 75            'device_id': self.device_id,
 76            'communication': True,
 77            'initialization': self._status.state != DeviceState.ERROR,
 78            'data_integrity': True,
 79            'overall_status': 'PASS'
 80        }
 81
 82        # Check if device is responsive
 83        try:
 84            await self.read_data()
 85        except Exception:
 86            test_results['communication'] = False
 87            test_results['overall_status'] = 'FAIL'
 88
 89        return test_results
 90
 91    async def _update_data_cache(self) -> None:
 92        """Update internal data cache."""
 93        # Base implementation provides synthetic data
 94        # Override in subclasses for actual device data
 95        self._data_cache = {
 96            'timestamp': time.time(),
 97            'device_id': self.device_id,
 98            'status': self._status.state.value,
 99            'uptime': self._status.uptime,
100            'error_count': self._status.error_count
101        }

DeviceManager¶

Manager for multiple device drivers.

This class provides centralized management of multiple devices, including lifecycle coordination, status monitoring, and coordinated operations.

Source Code¶

  1class DeviceManager:
  2    """
  3    Manager for multiple device drivers.
  4
  5    This class provides centralized management of multiple devices,
  6    including lifecycle coordination, status monitoring, and
  7    coordinated operations.
  8    """
  9
 10    def __init__(self):
 11        """Initialize device manager."""
 12        self._devices: Dict[str, DeviceDriver] = {}
 13        self._logger = logging.getLogger("device_manager")
 14
 15    def add_device(self, device: DeviceDriver) -> None:
 16        """Add device to manager."""
 17        device_id = device.device_id
 18        if device_id in self._devices:
 19            raise ValueError(f"Device {device_id} already exists in manager")
 20
 21        self._devices[device_id] = device
 22        self._logger.info(f"Added device {device_id} to manager")
 23
 24    def remove_device(self, device_id: str) -> Optional[DeviceDriver]:
 25        """Remove device from manager."""
 26        device = self._devices.pop(device_id, None)
 27        if device:
 28            self._logger.info(f"Removed device {device_id} from manager")
 29        return device
 30
 31    def get_device(self, device_id: str) -> Optional[DeviceDriver]:
 32        """Get device by ID."""
 33        return self._devices.get(device_id)
 34
 35    def list_devices(self) -> List[str]:
 36        """List all device IDs."""
 37        return list(self._devices.keys())
 38
 39    def get_devices_by_type(self, device_type: str) -> List[DeviceDriver]:
 40        """Get all devices of specific type."""
 41        return [
 42            device for device in self._devices.values()
 43            if device.device_type == device_type
 44        ]
 45
 46    async def start_all(self) -> Dict[str, bool]:
 47        """Start all devices."""
 48        results = {}
 49        for device_id, device in self._devices.items():
 50            try:
 51                results[device_id] = await device.start()
 52            except Exception as e:
 53                self._logger.error(f"Failed to start device {device_id}: {e}")
 54                results[device_id] = False
 55
 56        return results
 57
 58    async def stop_all(self) -> Dict[str, bool]:
 59        """Stop all devices."""
 60        results = {}
 61        for device_id, device in self._devices.items():
 62            try:
 63                results[device_id] = await device.stop()
 64            except Exception as e:
 65                self._logger.error(f"Failed to stop device {device_id}: {e}")
 66                results[device_id] = False
 67
 68        return results
 69
 70    async def restart_all(self) -> Dict[str, bool]:
 71        """Restart all devices."""
 72        results = {}
 73        for device_id, device in self._devices.items():
 74            try:
 75                results[device_id] = await device.restart()
 76            except Exception as e:
 77                self._logger.error(f"Failed to restart device {device_id}: {e}")
 78                results[device_id] = False
 79
 80        return results
 81
 82    def get_status_summary(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 83        """Get status summary for all devices."""
 84        summary = {
 85            'total_devices': len(self._devices),
 86            'states': {},
 87            'error_count': 0,
 88            'warning_count': 0,
 89            'devices': {}
 90        }
 91
 92        for device_id, device in self._devices.items():
 93            state = device.state.value
 94            summary['states'][state] = summary['states'].get(state, 0) + 1
 95            summary['error_count'] += device.status.error_count
 96            summary['warning_count'] += device.status.warning_count
 97            summary['devices'][device_id] = {
 98                'state': state,
 99                'type': device.device_type,
100                'last_update': device.status.last_update,
101                'error_count': device.status.error_count
102            }
103
104        return summary
105
106    async def health_check_all(self) -> Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]:
107        """Perform health check on all devices."""
108        results = {}
109        for device_id, device in self._devices.items():
110            try:
111                results[device_id] = await device.self_test()
112            except Exception as e:
113                self._logger.error(f"Health check failed for device {device_id}: {e}")
114                results[device_id] = {
115                    'overall_status': 'FAIL',
116                    'error': str(e)
117                }
118
119        return results
